results.title: Earthquake
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles and Film Associates
results.brief_description: Uses animation to demonstrate how an earthquake takes place. Shows the effects of earthquakes on landforms and on man-made structures. Explains how scientists learn more about earthquakes by studying the vibrations produced. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: University of California, Los Angeles and Film Associates
results.description: Uses animation to demonstrate how an earthquake takes place. Shows the effects of earthquakes on landforms and on man-made structures. Explains how scientists learn more about earthquakes by studying the vibrations produced. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Earthly beings
results.creator_credit: Chuck Eyler, Jacolyn Kildare and Heaping Teaspoon Animation
results.brief_description: An animated film depicting nature and the way it feeds upon itself. Ink and paint illustrations are from the works of anatomist, Andreas Vesalius of Brussels 1514-1564, Music is composed and conducted by Katherine Alisa Arnold

results.title: Earthlings can do anything
results.brief_description: This is a video package for upper primary school students which can be used in a number of curriculum areas, most appropriately for science/technology studies and careers/personal development. The emphasis is on developing the talents and skills of girls in traditional male dominated curriculum areas.

results.title: Earth, fire and water
results.creator_credit: Fred Richardson, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Documentary examination of Australian natural disasters. People are interviewed about their experiences in floods, bushfires, cyclones etc. Emergency services personnel give advice about the best way to prevent and cope with disasters

results.title: Earth satellites: explorers of outer space
results.brief_description: Scenes at the Army and Navy launching site show satellites being built, prepared for launching and taking off. Uses animated drawings to explain why satellites stay in orbit, how orbits may vary, and how information is received from satellites. Includes a sequence describing things to come in the space age.
results.description: Scenes at the Army and Navy launching site show satellites being built, prepared for launching and taking off. Uses animated drawings to explain why satellites stay in orbit, how orbits may vary, and how information is received from satellites. Includes a sequence describing things to come in the space age.

results.title: Earth is a battlefield
results.creator_credit: Dick Taylor, Geoffrey Sumner and W.M. Larkins Studio
results.brief_description: A light-hearted history of the contribution steel has made to world food supplies and the importance of exports made from steel in paying for imported food. Original animation techniques, with a good musical score and a commentary of rhyming couplets make for a delightful and useful film. Animation by Beryl Stevens and others
